title: So what if varus' sister ....
body:
What if the Darkin ended up inhabiting kassadins daughter and because of her void thing ended up being corrupted, and to seek power she wishes to fill he siblings and runeterra with that of the void.
But after years of resisting the void kassadins daughter is partially able to control her self with the energy of the Darkin having partially restored her mind.
So a stance swapping champ that could play as a support or mid laner with Darkin void icathyn and (possibly Shurima) influences?

Hellbent is an expression. Such as "He was hellbent on getting to work without being late."
It's very different than people saying "SEVEN DEADLY SINS! TAHM KENCH! EVELYNN! SHACO!" or "HORSEMEN OF APOCALPYSE! KAYN, VARUS, AATROX!"

And yes, the weapons are probably coincidence. Swords and Bows are INCREDIBLY common in a high fantasy setting. Drawing specific inferences from characters wielding swords or bows is like assuming that people who wear glasses are smarter than you are.
Scythes, also, are popular weapons in pop culture. People have an infatuation with the concept of the Grim Reaper, as well as the scythe he wields. It's a very common fascination, so it's not terribly unheard of that it would make it into a game like this. Having it also be tied to a demon of the soul and Kayn's battle for his own stems from this connection to the Grim Reaper.

Yes, someone wielding sword, bow or scythe is common in fantasy when it's independent. But they share theme. They are Darkins, quite obviously looking like judo-christian demons, the three Darkins just happen to wield these weapons. We have Garen who is the fantasy sword-wielder archetype, Ashe who is the fantasy bow-wielder archetype.

Also, I love how Kayn in your version is supposed to be inspired by death when the horseman of apocalypse that wields scythe in depictions is literally death, called Death and said to be accompanied by Hades. From this very fact I sense you are the fedora-type who just hates the idea that someone gets inspired by Biblical myths.

It's the same thing as If Riot released a wolf/dog-like champion from Freljord who represents doom, is connected to the end of the world by devouring and If someone pointed out it sounds like Fenrir you'd be like "I grow tired of people who are trying to apply Norse mythology everywhere".  LOL.

You've entirely missed my point. From a lore perspective, it would look bad if Riot tried to make a Shuriman-Demacian-Noxian-Darkin-Vastayan-etc champion. When you combine so many different themes together it begins to look like you were just checking off a list of things to include just for the sake of including them. It degrades the lore and robs it of its immersive-ness for the readers.

It becomes more of a homage to league's different factions than an actual character. Amumu, Corki, Udyr, and Fiddlesticks each have very strong thematics. Having a character with 3 or more factions combined into them leaves no room for cohesive themes to be core to the character. I honestly think that those 4 champions would have stronger thematics than the one you are suggesting here.

_Edit: Not saying I have a problem with your character overall, a transforming mage/support character that can hulk out sounds really cool, but I do not think it would be wise to tie their lore to so many factions._

I think it's a super cool idea but I doubt we'll ever see something with that many conflicting personalities. A weapon wielded by a little kid who also was corrupted by the Void may be a few too many steps into being convoluted to ever happen from a narrative perspective.

With that being said, I DO think there is a high chance that we will see Setaka in the game at some point, who is an Ascended Shuriman similar to Nasus and Renekton and once wielded the same weapon Sivir now uses. She died in Icathia when the Void incursion began, and I do think it is highly likely we will see a corrupted super-powerful version of her either in the game or at the very least in the lore at some point. We know the Void corrupts and takes over hosts, but other than Kassadin kinda starting to have it happen to him we haven't seen that on a champion yet, and I think a fully corrupted Void entity who is NOT a monster originally born in the Void would be super cool.

The Void is some sort of magical corruption that spreads and consumes, and is very different from the Darkin.  That said the last few remaining Darkin are contained within magical items, so it's not out of the question that a Darkin could be effected by the Void.

That said Riot has enough issues with their latest three way champion, I highly doubt they want to make a human girl possessed by a Darkin that is corrupted by the Void.

Still, even if exact details are not great it's not a terrible idea to think about.
